properties.areaDesc: Jefferson; Edwards; Gibson; Wabash; Pike; Wayne
properties.headline: Special Weather Statement issued January 30 at 9:31PM CST by NWS Paducah KY
properties.description:
A weather system is poised to move across the Quad State region
this evening and into the morning hours on Friday. As the
moisture moves into colder air overnight, some of the
precipitation will fall in the form of snow along the Interstate
64 corridor from Mount Vernon Illinois to Winslow Indiana.

Snowfall amounts are expected to remain light, generally a third
of an inch or less. The best time period for snow accumulation
would be from 2 am to 6 am CST Friday morning. With the warmer
ground and road temperatures, most, if any accumulation would be
limited to grassy or elevated road surfaces, such as bridges.

If you live, or are planning travel, along Interstate 64 in
southeast Illinois and southwest Indiana, be watchful for the
development of snow overnight. Drive accordingly and allow extra
time to reach your destination.

NWSheadline: Minor snow accumulation possible along the Interstate 64 corridor in southeast Illinois and southwest Indiana overnight
